There are several ways to make eBooks selling online super profitable. Here are some tips that can help:

1. Write a great book: The first and foremost thing that can make your eBook profitable is to write a great book. The book should be interesting, informative, and engaging. It should be able to grab the attention of the readers and keep them engaged till the end.
2. Create an effective marketing plan: Once you have written a great book, you need to market it effectively. This includes creating a website or landing page to sell your book, utilizing social media platforms, running ads, and reaching out to bloggers, influencers, and book reviewers.
3. Choose the right pricing strategy: Pricing is crucial when it comes to selling eBooks online. You need to choose a pricing strategy that is attractive to your target audience. You can offer discounts or bundle deals to attract more customers.
4. Use Amazon Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP): Amazon KDP is a great platform to sell eBooks online. You can easily publish your book on Amazon and reach millions of potential customers. You can also use Amazon's promotional tools to market your book.
5. Build an email list: Building an email list is important if you want to sell eBooks online. You can use email marketing to promote your book and inform your subscribers about new releases, discounts, and promotions.
6. Offer bonuses and extras: To make your eBook more attractive, you can offer bonuses and extras such as free eBooks, exclusive content, or access to a private Facebook group.
7. Focus on customer service: Customer service is important when it comes to selling eBooks online. You need to make sure that your customers are satisfied with your product and provide them with excellent support.

In summary, to make eBooks selling online super profitable, you need to focus on writing a great book, creating an effective marketing plan, choosing the right pricing strategy, using Amazon KDP, building an email list, offering bonuses and extras, and focusing on customer service.
